results.title: Choice of antihypertensive agent in isolated systolic hypertension and isolated diastolic hypertension: A secondary analysis of the ALLHAT trial.
results.text_hl: We compared the use of @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on the primary outcome of combined @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@, @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@, or all-cause mortality in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with isolated @DISEASE_Isolated_Systolic_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000092244 @@@systolic hypertension@@@ or isolated @DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang SY, Hanna JM, Gongal P, Onuma OK, Nanna MG. Choice of antihypertensive agent in isolated systolic hypertension and isolated diastolic hypertension: A secondary analysis of the ALLHAT trial. Am Heart J. 2022 Dec;254():30-34. PMID: 35932912
citations.BibTeX: @article{35932912, title={Choice of antihypertensive agent in isolated systolic hypertension and isolated diastolic hypertension: A secondary analysis of the ALLHAT trial.}, author={Wang SY and Hanna JM and Gongal P and Onuma OK and Nanna MG}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={254}, pages={30-34}}

results.title: The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.
results.text_hl: METHODS: The Antihypertensive and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@Lipid@@@-Lowering Treatment to Prevent @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@Heart Attack@@@ Trial (ALLHAT) was a randomized clinical trial on the effects of first-step @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ therapy with @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on fatal @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ or nonfatal @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (1994-2002).

citations.NLM: Juraschek SP, Simpson LM, Davis BR, Shmerling RH, Beach JL, Ishak A, Mukamal KJ. The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial. J Hypertens. 2020 May;38(5):954-960. PMID: 31977576
citations.BibTeX: @article{31977576, title={The effects of antihypertensive class on gout in older adults: secondary analysis of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.}, author={Juraschek SP and Simpson LM and Davis BR and Shmerling RH and Beach JL and Ishak A and Mukamal KJ}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={38}, number={5}, pages={954-960}}

results.title: Evaluation of Adverse Effects of Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin on Hematological and Biochemical Analytes in Wistar Rats
results.text_hl: Combination therapy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ may be an important concept in developing more effective strategies to treat and prevent @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@, and co-morbid @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@metabolic disorders@@@.

citations.NLM: Dodiya H, Kale V, Goswami S, Sundar R, Jain M. Evaluation of Adverse Effects of Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin on Hematological and Biochemical Analytes in Wistar Rats Toxicol Int. 2013 May;20(2):170-6. PMID: 24082511

results.title: [A fixed-dose lisinopril and amlodipine combination in conjunction with rosuvastatin in patients with hypertensive disease and coronary heart disease].

results.title: [Efficacy of ACEI in the treatment of hypertension and the effect of secondary prevention in patients complicated with coronary heart disease and stroke].
results.journal: Nan Fang Yi Ke Da Xue Xue Bao
results.text_hl: The effect of antihypertensive and two levels of prevention of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ complicated with @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ is positive.

results.title: Mortality and morbidity during and after the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.
results.text_hl: A randomized, double-blind, active-controlled, multicenter trial assigned 32,804 @SPECIES_9606 @@@participants@@@ aged 55 years and older with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and >= 1 other @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ risk factors to receive @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ (n=15,002), @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (n=8898), or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (n=8904) for 4 to 8 years, when double-blinded therapy was discontinued.

citations.NLM: Cushman WC, Davis BR, Pressel SL, Cutler JA, Einhorn PT, Ford CE, Oparil S, Probstfield JL, Whelton PK, Wright JT Jr, Alderman MH, Basile JN, Black HR, Grimm RH Jr, Hamilton BP, Haywood LJ, Ong ST, Piller LB, Simpson LM, Stanford C, Weiss RJ, ALLHAT Collaborative Research Group. Mortality and morbidity during and after the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial. J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2012 Jan;14(1):20-31. PMID: 22235820
citations.BibTeX: @article{22235820, title={Mortality and morbidity during and after the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial.}, author={Cushman WC and Davis BR and Pressel SL and Cutler JA and Einhorn PT and Ford CE and Oparil S and Probstfield JL and Whelton PK and Wright JT Jr and Alderman MH and Basile JN and Black HR and Grimm RH Jr and Hamilton BP and Haywood LJ and Ong ST and Piller LB and Simpson LM and Stanford C and Weiss RJ and ALLHAT Collaborative Research Group}, journal={J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich)}, volume={14}, number={1}, pages={20-31}}

results.title: [Clinical study of the month. Which initial antihypertensive? Results from the ALLHAT trial].
results.text_hl: A total of 33,357 participants aged 55 years or older with mild to moderate @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and at least 1 other @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@CHD@@@ risk factor were randomly assigned to receive @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ (12.5 to 25 mg/day; n = 15,255), @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (2.5 to 10 mg/day; n = 9,048) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (10 to 40 mg; n = 9,054).

citations.NLM: Scheen AJ, Krzesinski JM. [Clinical study of the month. Which initial antihypertensive? Results from the ALLHAT trial]. Rev Med Liege. 2003 Jan;58(1):47-52. PMID: 12647599
citations.BibTeX: @article{12647599, title={[Clinical study of the month. Which initial antihypertensive? Results from the ALLHAT trial].}, author={Scheen AJ and Krzesinski JM}, journal={Rev Med Liege}, volume={58}, number={1}, pages={47-52}}
